response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  i = i + 1;
    names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSON object: I have a JSON object that looks like this: { "key1": "value1", "key2": "value2", "key3": "value3" } I want to get the value of the key "key1". I tried this: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString); String key1 = jsonObject.getString("key1"); But it doesn't work. I also tried this: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString); String key1 = jsonObject.getJSONObject("key1").getString("key1"); But it doesn't work either. I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong.
Please using this api: JSONObject.getString("key1").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.getString("key1")
<<<code>>>: String key1 = jsonObject.getString("key1");
<<<explanation>>>: You're using the wrong method. You need to use JSONObject.getJSONObject("key1").getString("key1").
